Patent Information.Patent Title: Papillosin antimicrobial peptide, a gene coding said peptide, a vector, a transformed organism and a compound containing said organism.
Patent Information.Abstract: A antimicrobial peptide isolated from an extract from a marine invertebrate, whose amino acid sequence is as follows: GFWKKVGSAAWGGVKAAAKGAAVGGLNALAKHIQ (SEQ ID No. 1), its derivatives, its fragments and a polypeptide, as well as transformed host organisms capable of producing the peptide such as microorganisms, animal cells, digital cells and plants, and an anti-microbial composition containing the peptide.

Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.19085906]Gram-positive bacteria (Native, Synthetic):Micrococcus luteus A270 (MBC=0.13-0.25, 0.19-0.39 µM), Aerococcus viridans 54.145 T (MBC=ND, 0.19-0.39 µM), Bacillus megaterium 66.20 T (MBC=ND, 0.05-0.10 µM), Staphylococcus aureus 65.8 T (MBC=0.5-1.00, 1.56-3.13 µM), Enterococcus faecalis 103015 T (MBC=ND, 0.78-1.56 µM);Gram-negative bacteria (Native, Synthetic):Enterobacter aerogenes 30.86 T (MBC=ND, 0.78-1.56 µM), Pseudomonas aeruginosa 100720 T (MBC=ND, 3.13-6.25 µM), Salmonella thyphimurium 60.62 T (MBC=ND, 0.78-1.56 µM), Klebsiella pneumoniae 82.91 T (MBC=ND, 0.39-0.78 µM), Escherichia coli (MBC=0.25-0.50, 0.78-1.56 µM)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.19085906]0% hemolytic activity at 50 μM against sheep erythrocytes
Sequence Information.Function: Has strong antibacterial activity against the Gram-positive bacteria M. luteus, S. aureus, B. megaterium, A. viridans and E. faecalis, and against the Gram-negative bacteria K. pneumoniae, E. coli DH5alpha, S. typhimurium, P. aeruginosa and E. aerogenes. Lacks hemolytic activity against sheep erythrocytes.

Literature.Title: Halocyntin and papillosin, two new antimicrobial peptides isolated from hemocytes of the solitary tunicate, Halocynthia papillosa.
Literature.Author: Galinier R, Roger E, Sautiere PE, Aumelas A, Banaigs B, Mitta G.
